description: Replaces all triggers for a repository. Used to create or delete triggers.

parameters.name: repositoryName
parameters.description: The name of the repository where you want to create or update the trigger.

parameters.name: triggers
parameters.description: The JSON block of configuration information for each trigger. (dict) --- Information about a trigger for a repository. The name of the trigger. The ARN of the resource that is the target for a trigger (for example, the ARN of a topic in Amazon SNS). customData (string) --- Any custom data associated with the trigger to be included in the information sent to the target of the trigger. branches (list) --- The branches to be included in the trigger configuration. If you specify an empty array, the trigger applies to all branches. (string) --- The repository events that cause the trigger to run actions in another service, such as sending a notification through Amazon SNS. (string) ---

nested_params.name: destinationArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the resource that is the target for a trigger (for example, the ARN of a topic in Amazon SNS).

nested_params.name: customData
nested_params.description: Any custom data associated with the trigger to be included in the information sent to the target of the trigger.

nested_params.name: branches
nested_params.description: The branches to be included in the trigger configuration. If you specify an empty array, the trigger applies to all branches.

nested_params.name: events
nested_params.description: The repository events that cause the trigger to run actions in another service, such as sending a notification through Amazon SNS.

nested_items.name: configurationId
nested_items.description: The system-generated unique ID for the create or update operation.
